pr_title: #1554 - Set error response to not-found on missing code or system

timeline.message:
I updated the code so that a new type of FHIROperationException is thrown
with the code not-found when the code system lookup returns no result.
This will cause a 404 instead of a 400 error, but that is consistent
with the behavior of the HAPI FHIR server, so it feels ok to me. 404
makes sense as NOT_FOUND.

Signed-off-by: Corey Sanders <sandersc@us.ibm.com>

I updated the code so that a new type of FHIROperationException is thrown
with the code not-found when the code system lookup returns no result.
This will cause a 404 instead of a 400 error, but that is consistent
with the behavior of the HAPI FHIR server, so it feels ok to me. 404
makes sense as NOT_FOUND.

Signed-off-by: Corey Sanders <sandersc@us.ibm.com>

Based on PR feedback switch to HTTP 400

Per recommendation from the core team, using the FHIR extension
mechanism to indicate to the framework that the HTTP status code should
change from the default behavior.

Signed-off-by: Corey Sanders <sandersc@us.ibm.com>

Merge branch 'csandersdev-1626-termlookup' of git@github.com:csandersdev/FHIR.git into csandersdev-1626-termlookup

fix end-of-line chars

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: is this actually the case?  I don't think it can be disabled.
timeline.author: prb112
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -58,4 +58,10 @@
             <package name="com.ibm.fhir.server.test.performance" />
         </packages>
     </test>
-</suite>
\ No newline at end of file
+    <test name="TerminologyTests">
+        <packages>
+            <!-- All of these terminology tests are disabled by default, and enabled in test.properties -->

replies.bodyText:
good catch.  originally corey wrote it so that it can be enabled/disabled from test.properties.  I requested him to remove that since the terminology stuff gets baked into the server...there should be no need to disable them in this way

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        <!-- All of these terminology tests are disabled by default, and enabled in test.properties -->
          
          
            
                        <!-- All of these tests are automatically executed -->
replies.author: lmsurpre
